H5281.def: = woman, who at some time called herself {L:Mara<SDBH:מָרָא>}; ► wife of {L:Elimelech<SDBH:אֱלִימֶלֶךְ>}, mother of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>} and {L:Chilion<SDBH:כִּלְיֹון>}, and mother-in-law of {L:Ruth<SDBH:רוּת>} and {L:Orpah<SDBH:עָרְפָּה>}

H3498.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects remain in a certain place after part of the original quantity has been located elsewhere

H7648.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H375.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H3950.def: = causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H575.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H1162.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Salma<SDBH:שַׂלְמָא>}, {L:Salmon<SDBH:שַׂלְמֹון>}; ► husband of {L:Ruth<SDBH:רוּת>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H5281.def: = woman, who at some time called herself {L:Mara<SDBH:מָרָא>}; ► wife of {L:Elimelech<SDBH:אֱלִימֶלֶךְ>}, mother of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>} and {L:Chilion<SDBH:כִּלְיֹון>}, and mother-in-law of {L:Ruth<SDBH:רוּת>} and {L:Orpah<SDBH:עָרְפָּה>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H7327.def: = woman; ◄ from {L:Moab<SDBH:מֹואָב>}; ► wife of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>}, son of {L:Elimelech<SDBH:אֱלִימֶלֶךְ>}, after the death of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>} she married {L:Boaz<SDBH:בֹּעַז>} and so became the mother of {L:Obed<SDBH:עֹובֵד>} and the great-grandmother of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7327.def: = woman; ◄ from {L:Moab<SDBH:מֹואָב>}; ► wife of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>}, son of {L:Elimelech<SDBH:אֱלִימֶלֶךְ>}, after the death of {L:Mahlon<SDBH:מַחְלֹון>} she married {L:Boaz<SDBH:בֹּעַז>} and so became the mother of {L:Obed<SDBH:עֹובֵד>} and the great-grandmother of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H5291.def: = a young female, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people

H6293.def: = process by which humans or animals unexpectedly meet other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H5291.def: = a young female, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people

H1162.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Salma<SDBH:שַׂלְמָא>}, {L:Salmon<SDBH:שַׂלְמֹון>}; ► husband of {L:Ruth<SDBH:רוּת>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H3950.def: = causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation
